trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Rral Ty'ukuk has an infestation on his hands.

TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_000<tab>You're one of Wuk Lamat's companions, aren't you? Stout of arm, fierce of mien...yes, I think you might be just the person I'm looking for to take care of a little pest problem.

TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_001<tab>Since the storm raged through these parts, we've seen a marked increase in the number of ill-tempered mantises. If left unchecked, they could prove a threat to the forest's natural balance.

TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_002<tab>Normally, I'd send a group of our own to take care of them, but we're shorthanded at the moment. I reckon you could do the culling of a pair of hunters, though.
TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_003<tab>So, I'll ask you to rid us of two of these nuisances. You can find them to the south of our village─and good luck, though I doubt you need it.
TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_005<tab>Though you may be tempted to slaughter them all, two should be enough to keep their numbers in check.
TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_010<tab>You're back, and much quicker than I thought you'd be! You've made a difference today, even if you can't tell at a glance.
TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_011<tab>Those things are ravenous, and mindlessly engulf smaller prey to sate their bottomless hunger.

TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_012<tab>Normally larger animals would keep their numbers in check, but there are far fewer predators stalking the woods since the storm. This has given the mantises a chance to flourish, but at the expense of everything else.

TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_013<tab>Of course, the natural inclination of living things is to reproduce, but nature rests on a delicate balance. Maintaining that balance is only one of a hunter's duties.

TEXT_KINGZD001_05090_RRALTYUKUK_000_014<tab>Today you helped us restore a small bit of harmony to the forest, and I hope you gained a deeper understanding of our relationship to the land we call home. I'm honored to have worked with one of Wuk Lamat's own!
